org.writeforward.logger

Class ConfigurationBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.writeforward.logger.ConfigurationBuilder

  • public class ConfigurationBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a fluent builder for configuring a WriteForwardConfiguration.
    Author:
    Matt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit()
      Commits this to the Log object for immediate use.
      ConfigurationBuilder isSlow(java.lang.Boolean slow)
      Sets isSlow.
      ConfigurationBuilder numberOfStackFrames(int frames)
      How many stack frames do you want to output during each log event? Your could output all of them all the time, but that gets old fast.

      Enables/Activates a level for outputting.
      ConfigurationBuilder withInactiveLevel(Level l)

    • Method Detail

      • isSlow

        public ConfigurationBuilder isSlow(java.lang.Boolean slow)
        Sets isSlow. If true it will not do any expensive reflection or stack trace operations.
        Parameters:
        slow - True if you want max performance at the expense of useful information.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • numberOfStackFrames

        public ConfigurationBuilder numberOfStackFrames(int frames)
        How many stack frames do you want to output during each log event? Your could output all of them all the time, but that gets old fast.
        Parameters:
        frames - I suggest 0 as a good number for most purposes.
        Returns:
        this object

      • withOutput

        public ConfigurationBuilder withOutput(Output o)
        Add an output object to the configuration. Output objects are responsible for dealing with the underling logging framework (like Log4J or SLF4J.) There are several implementations already for you: JavaLoggingOutput, Slf4jOutput, and StandardOutput. Each Output requires a formatter to format the output message. You can find the PebbleFormatter That takes a Pebble format (http://www.mitchellbosecke.com/pebble/home) as a string.
        Parameters:
        o - Your output object.
        Returns:
        this Object

      • withActiveLevel

        public ConfigurationBuilder withActiveLevel(Level l)
        Enables/Activates a level for outputting. Use this after adding all of your outputters.
        Parameters:
        l - The level you want outputted to the underlining framework.
        Returns:
        this object

      • withInactiveLevel

        public ConfigurationBuilder withInactiveLevel(Level l)
        Deactivate a level from the output. Use this after adding all of your outputters.
        Parameters:
        l - The level you do not want to send to the logging framework.
        Returns:
        this object

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commits this to the Log object for immediate use.
